title: B5084.pdf
content:
ty, pungent foods and over eating is best avoided.Exercise and sexual activities must be minimised. If taking a nap during the day,  cool environment is indicated. Application of paste of cooling agents like sandalwood, 
rose petals, etc. on skin and face is 
good.
Monsoon (Jul.-Aug.)Hot sour, salty, light, a little oily, and easily 
digestible, soups can 
be taken.Powder massage and application of herbal pastes with fragrance 
on skin. Excess exercise, sexual 
intercourse, sleeping during the day, sleeping in the dew and on the ground, letting stagnant water stay in surrounding areas, damp areas and excess exposure to strong sun rays must be avoided. 
 Autumn (Sept.-Oct.)Sweet, bitter, light & cold food is preferable. Avoid curd/yogurt sour, salty,  pungent and heavy foodsSitting in moonlight in the first quarter of the night is advised. Sleeping during the day must be avoided.
Early winter (Nov.-Dec.)Intake of heavy, oily, sweet, sour,
